List of Courses

This section aims at presenting a non-exhaustive list of the Data Science-related courses that I followed untill and including now during my cursus at EPFL and ETH.

Current Courses

Spring 2020

EE-559

Prof. François Fleuret: Empirical risk minimization, Multi-layer perceptron,Autograd, CNN, Dropout, Deep models for Computer Vision, Auto-encoders, Generative models, Recurrent models, NLP

website

Dr. Eric Bouillet: Distributed Computing with Hadoop, HDFS, Parquet, HBase, Hive, Zookeeper, Ambari, Spark, Yarn, Mesos, Stream Processing, Large-Scale Data Analysis

CS-439

Prof. Martin Jaggi: Convexity, Gradient Methods, Proximal algorithms, Coordinate Descent Methods, Subgradient Methods, Non-Convex Optimization, Frank-Wolfe, Accelerated Methods, Primal-Dual context and certificates, Lagrange and Fenchel Duality, Second-Order Methods, Quasi-Newton Methods, Gradient-Free and Zero-Order Optimization.

COM-480

Dr. Laurent-Gilles Marie Vuillon: Data visualization Web, Maps, Javascript, Text visualization, Graphs, Tabular data viz, Music viz, Intro to scientific visualisation

Master Courses

CS-401

Prof. Robert West (EPFL) Data Visualization (D3, Bokeh), NLP (nltk), Document Classification, Topic Detection, Latent Dirichlet Allocation, TF-IDF, Networks (Networkx), Observational studies, Data Cleaning/Preprocessing, WebScrapping, Pandas, SPARK,

CS-433

Prof. Martin Jaggi (EPFL) Cost functions,Model Selection and Validation, Bias-Variance Decomposition, Generalized Linear Models, SVM, Kernel Regressions, Gaussian Mixture Models, EM algorithm, SVD,PCA, Neural Networks, Adversarial ML, CNN, Graphical Models, Bayes Nets, Factor Graphs,MLE,MAP estimation, Probabilistic interprations, Under,overfitting, Ridge,Linear regression, Lasso

EE-558

Prof. Vandergheist (EPFL) Data Mining, Spectral Clustering, Graph Neural Networks, Graph theory, Random Networks, Erdos-Renyi Model, Small-world property, ScaleFree Networks

COM-300

Continuous and Discrete stochastic processes (second order analysis : ergodism, stationarity, harmonic analysis), Poisson processes, Discrete and Continuous Markov Chains, Introduction to Queuing Theory

MATH-360

BFS shortest path, Hamilton paths, Matchings, Flows (König's theorem), Tutte matrix and Schwartz-zippel Lemma, Colorings, Menger's theorem, Probabilstic methods, Ramsey's theorem

Bachelor Courses

website

Prof. Petros Koumoutsakos (ETH): Shared Memory, Concurrency, Threads, OpenMP, HPC libraries, Distributed Memory (MPI), Strong/Weak scaling

website

Prof. Andrea Krause (ETH): Model Selection, Cross Validation, Classification, Feature Selection, Kernels, Class Imbalance, Neural Nets, Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction, Probabilistic Modelling, Logistic Regression, Decision Theory, Generate Modelling, GMMs, GANs

website

Prof. Emo Welezl (ETH): Min Spanning Trees, Randomized search trees, Point Location, Linear Programming, Randomized Algebraic Algorithms, Parallel Algorithms

website

Prof. Peter Müller (ETH): FuncProg: (Haskell) Proofs by inductions, Recursions, Noetherian induction, Correctness, Terminations, Typing, Type Checking, Type Inference, Type Classes, List Comprehension, Algebraic Data Types, Lazy Evaluation, Monads
Formal Methods: Axiomatic Semantics, Modeling, Linear Temporal Logic, Model Checking (spin)

website

Dr. Ghislain Fourny (ETH): Object/Key-value storage, Distributed File Systems (HDFS),Syntax (XML,CSV,JSON),Column Stores (BigTable),Data Models, MapReduce (Hadoop), YARN, SPARK, Document Stores, Qerying Trees

website

Fabio Sigrist (ETH): Multivariate Outliers, Visualization, Factor Analysis, PCA, Multidensional Scaling, Kernel PCA, t-SNE, ISOMAP, Linar Discriminant Analysis (LDA),Quadratic Discriminant Analysis, Random Forests, Mixed Effects Models
